text: Beauty is everlasting And dust is for a time.
author: Marianne Moore

text: Here in L.A. the standard of beauty is kind of ridiculous. I want to be doing this when I'm in my fifties and sixties and this isn't what I'm going to look like.
author: Rose Byrne

text: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
author: Oliver Platt

text: But, when the work was finished, the Craftsman kept wishing that there were someone to ponder the plan of so great a work, to love its beauty, and to wonder at its vastness.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

text: My father always taught by telling stories about his experiences. His lessons were about morality and art and what insects and birds and human beings had in common. He told me what it meant to be a man and to be a Black man. He taught me about love and responsibility, about beauty, and how to make gumbo.
author: Walter Mosley
